Interlakes Highway |established=1967 |direction_a=West |terminus_a={{jct|state=BC|Hwy|97}} near [[93 Mile House]] |junction= |direction_b=East |terminus_b={{jct|state=BC|Hwy|5}} in [[Little Fort, British Columbia|Little Fort]] |previous_type=Hwy |previous_route=23 |next_type=Hwy |next_route=26 }} '''Highway 24''', also known as the '''Little Fort Highway''' or the '''Interlakes Highway''', is a 97 km-long east-west connection between the [[British Columbia Highway 97|Cariboo Highway]], just south of [[100 Mile House, British Columbia|100 Mile House]], and the [[British Columbia Highway 5|Southern Yellowhead Highway]] at [[Little Fort, British Columbia|Little Fort]]. It practically provides a "second-chance" route to travellers heading east from [[Vancouver, British Columbia|Vancouver]] who believe they chose the wrong route to the northern part of the province or toward [[Edmonton, Alberta|Edmonton]]. Highway 24 first opened in [[1967]]. ==Route description== Highway 24 begins in the west at [[93 Mile House]], approximately 11 km (7 mi) south of [[100 Mile House]]. After 9 km (6 mi), it passes through the small community of [[Lone Butte, British Columbia|Lone Butte]]. After passing several turn-offs to resort lakes including Sheridan Lake, the highway passes through the community of [[Bridge Lake, British Columbia|Bridge Lake]], 38 km (24 mi) later. The highway then proceeds another 50 km (31 mi) east through the forest and over a large hill before reaching its terminus in Little Fort. A very scenic drive, the highway follows a historic trail used by the [[Secwepemc|Shuswap people]] as a trade route and was later developed by the [[Hudson's Bay Company]] in the early 19th century to bring furs from northern BC out to Fort Kamloops and the [[Columbia River]]. ==See also== *[[Hudson's Bay Brigade Trail]] * [http://www.th.gov.bc.ca/publications/planning/numbered_routes.htm Numbered Routes in British Columbia]Ministry of Transportation Publication *[http://www.fishinghighway24.com The Fishing Highway area information] ==Notes== {{Reflist}} {{BCHighways}} [[Category:British Columbia provincial highways|024]] [[Category:Interior of British Columbia]] [[Category:Cariboo Country]] [[Category:Thompson Country]]
